README.md.old_code:
# User Stories for Login and Dashboard (JIRA Format)

---

## 🧑‍💻 Login Screen

### 📝 Story: Display Login Form

**Title:** Display Login Form

**Description:**  
As a user, I want to see a login form with fields for email and password, so that I can enter my credentials to access the app.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The login form includes:
  - Email input field
  - Password input field
  - Login button
- Basic client-side validation:
  - Required fields
  - Proper email format
- Error messages are shown for invalid inputs

**Story Points:** 3
README.md.changes:
- Improved formatting for clarity and readability.
- Added a top-level "Table of Contents" for easier navigation.
- Added a "Purpose" section for context.
- Used consistent heading levels and spacing.
- Clarified acceptance criteria with checklists for better tracking.
- Added a "Notes" section for implementation hints.
- Ensured concise, actionable language throughout.
README.md.updated_code:
# User Stories for Login and Dashboard (JIRA Format)

---

## Table of Contents

- [Purpose](#purpose)
- [Login Screen](#login-screen)
  - [Story: Display Login Form](#story-display-login-form)
    - [Acceptance Criteria](#acceptance-criteria)
    - [Notes](#notes)

---

## Purpose

This document outlines user stories and acceptance criteria for the Login and Dashboard features, formatted for JIRA.

---

## 🧑‍💻 Login Screen

### 📝 Story: Display Login Form

**Title:** Display Login Form

**Description:**  
As a user, I want to see a login form with fields for email and password, so that I can enter my credentials to access the app.

#### Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] The login form includes:
  - [ ] Email input field
  - [ ] Password input field
  - [ ] Login button
- [ ] Basic client-side validation:
  - [ ] Required fields
  - [ ] Proper email format
- [ ] Error messages are shown for invalid inputs

**Story Points:** 3

---

#### Notes

- The login form should be accessible and responsive.
- Error messages should be clear and user-friendly.
- Validation should occur on input blur and on form submission.

client/index.html.changes:
- Improved accessibility by adding `lang="en"` to the `<html>` tag (already present).
- Added `aria-label="Application Root"` to the root div for better accessibility.
- Added a `<meta name="description">` for basic SEO and accessibility.
- Set a more descriptive and static `<title>` ("Login | App") instead of a template variable.
- Added `autocomplete="off"` to the root form container to prevent browser autofill issues on login forms.
- Added a `<noscript>` tag to inform users if JavaScript is disabled.
- Ensured favicon uses a more descriptive `alt` attribute for accessibility.
- Minor formatting for consistency.

client/src/assets/react.svg.changes:
- Removed unnecessary `xmlns:xlink` and `aria-hidden`, `role`, and `class` attributes for a cleaner SVG.
- Set `width="36"` and `height="32"` for more standard sizing (rounded up from 35.93).
- Formatted the SVG for readability (indented, line breaks).
- Ensured only essential attributes remain for best practice and maintainability.

client/src/components/LoginForm.tsx.changes:
- Added `handleSubmit` function to handle form submission and validation.
- Improved client-side validation: checks for required fields and proper email format.
- Added `aria-invalid` and `aria-describedby` for accessibility on input fields.
- Added `autoComplete` attributes for better UX.
- Trimmed email input on change.
- Disabled the login button while submitting (added `isSubmitting` state).
- Improved error message display and structure.
- Added `required` attribute to input fields for native browser validation support.
- Minor code style and structure improvements.

client/package.json.changes:
- Sorted `scripts`, `dependencies`, and `devDependencies` alphabetically for consistency.
- Updated `typescript-eslint` in `devDependencies` to `@typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin`, `@typescript-eslint/parser`, and `@typescript-eslint/utils` for clarity and best practices.
- Updated `@eslint/js`, `@types/react`, `@types/react-dom`, `@vitejs/plugin-react`, `eslint`, `eslint-plugin-react-refresh`, and `prettier` to their latest versions to ensure up-to-date tooling.
- Updated `eslint-plugin-react-refresh` version to match the one in `package-lock.json`.
- Updated `typescript` version to match the one in `package-lock.json`.
- Ensured all versions match those in `package-lock.json` for consistency.
- No functional changes to lint-staged config.

client/src/main.tsx.changes:
- Removed the unnecessary `.tsx` extension from the `App` import for consistency and best practices.
- Added a null check for the root element and throw an explicit error if not found, improving robustness and type safety.

client/src/index.css.changes:
- Added styling for the login form, including `.form-group`, `label`, `input`, and `.error` classes to ensure a clean, accessible, and user-friendly login experience.
- Improved button focus style for better accessibility.
- Enhanced body centering for vertical and horizontal alignment.
- Added input focus and error state styles for better validation feedback.
- Ensured color contrast and spacing for accessibility and visual clarity.
- Added responsive adjustments for smaller screens.

client/src/App.tsx.changes:
- Added a container div with improved semantic structure and accessibility.
- Added a visually hidden h1 for accessibility, and used a section for the login form.
- Added a short description above the form for user guidance.
- Added a wrapper for the login form to center and constrain its width for better UX.
- Added ARIA attributes for better accessibility.
- Improved class names for easier styling and maintainability.

client/README.md.changes:
- Replaced the default Vite/React template README with user stories for the Login and Dashboard in JIRA format, as described in the prompt.
- Removed all unrelated Vite/React/ESLint documentation.
- Ensured the file contains only the user story for the Login Screen as specified.
client/README.md.updated_code:
# User Stories for Login and Dashboard (JIRA Format)

---

## 🧑‍💻 Login Screen

### 📝 Story: Display Login Form

**Title:** Display Login Form

**Description:**  
As a user, I want to see a login form with fields for email and password, so that I can enter my credentials to access the app.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The login form includes:
  - Email input field
  - Password input field
  - Login button
- Basic client-side validation:
  - Required fields
  - Proper email format
- Error messages are shown for invalid inputs

**Story Points:** 3

client/src/App.css.changes:
- Added styles for `.login-form`, `.form-group`, `label`, `input[type="email"]`, `input[type="password"]`, and `.error` to provide a clean, accessible, and visually appealing login form.
- Improved button styling for better focus and hover states.
- Ensured responsive and accessible form layout.
- Kept existing styles for `.logo`, `.card`, and `.read-the-docs` for compatibility.
